lines.content: # AI Tools Used in My Project
I used ChatGPT for fixing some of my Javadoc comments. It saved time and worked well, but I still had to manually fix some of the formatting errors.
I used Claude.ai to debug an error where the application crashes when the first command entered upon running is invalid.

* Acts as a workaround for JavaFX classpath issues when starting the application.
* @param args Command-line arguments passed to the application.
* The main entry point for the Snowman GUI application using JavaFX.
* Initializes the primary stage, loads the FXML layout, injects the Snowman instance
* into the GUI controller, and displays the main window. Handles stage sizing
* and ensures the GUI is correctly linked to the underlying Snowman application logic.
private final Snowman snowman = new Snowman("data/storage.txt");
* Starts the JavaFX application by setting up the primary stage.
* Loads the FXML layout, creates a scene, sets stage size limits, injects
* the Snowman instance into the controller, and displays the window.
* @param stage The primary stage for this application.
* Controller for the main GUI of the Snowman application.
* Handles user input, displays dialog boxes for both the user and Snowman,
* and maintains the scrollable dialog container in the GUI.
* Binds the vertical scroll value of the ScrollPane to the height of
* the dialog container so that it scrolls automatically as new dialog boxes are added.
* Injects the Snowman instance into the GUI controller.
* Handles user input from the text field.
* Creates two dialog boxes: one showing the user's input and
* the other showing Snowman's response. Appends the dialog boxes
* to the dialog container and clears the user input field.
* The Snowman class initializes the user interface, storage, and task list,
* and handles execution of user commands. It supports both console and GUI modes.
* Initializes the user interface, storage, and task list using the provided file path.
* @param filePath Path to the file used for saving and loading tasks.
* Runs the Snowman application in console mode.
* Displays a welcome message, then repeatedly reads user commands,
* parses and executes them, handles errors, and terminates when an ExitCommand is issued.
* Starts the Snowman application with a default storage file.
* Generates a response string for a given user input in GUI mode.
* Parses the input into a command, executes it, and returns the resulting feedback.
* @return Feedback string generated by executing the corresponding command.
* Returns the type of the most recently executed command.
* @return Command class name of the last executed command.
* Represents exceptions specific to the Snowman application.
* Thrown when an error occurs during command parsing, execution, or other operations.
* Constructs a SnowmanException with the specified error message.
* Represents a command in the Snowman application.
* All commands must extend this class and implement the execute method.
* Provides a default implementation of {@link #isExit()} to indicate if the command exits the application.
* Executes this command using the given task list, UI, and storage.
* Subclasses must implement this method to define their behavior.
* @param tasks TaskList object managing all tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for displaying messages to the user.
* @param storage Storage object for saving or loading tasks from file.
* @throws SnowmanException If the command cannot be executed due to invalid input or other errors.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws SnowmanException;
* Indicates whether this command signals the application to exit.
* By default, commands do not exit the application.
* @return true if this command exits the application; false otherwise.

- Shows all tasks in your list.
- Marks a task as not done.

* Represents an Event task in the Snowman application.
